Package net.tnemc.core.currency

Interface CurrencyType

All Known Implementing Classes:
ExperienceType, ItemType, MixedType, VirtualType
public interface CurrencyType
Represents a type of currency.
Since:
0.1.2.0
Author:
creatorfromhell
See Also:
  • Currency

  • Method Details

    • name

      String name()
      Returns:
      The name of this currency type. Examples: Virtual, Item

    • offline

      default boolean offline()
      Returns:
      True if this currency type supports offline players, otherwise false.

    • loginCalculation

      default boolean loginCalculation()
      Returns:
      True if this currency requires setting the player's balance when they log in. This should be true for currency types like item currency.

    • database

      default boolean database()
      Returns:
      If balances of this currency type should be saved to the database. Return false to do your own data handling.

    • supportsVirtual

      default boolean supportsVirtual()

    • supportsItems

      default boolean supportsItems()
      Returns:
      True if this currency type is based on physical items.

    • defaultHandler

      default Identifier defaultHandler()
      Returns:
      The Identifier of the default handler.

    • supportsExchange

      default boolean supportsExchange()
      Returns:
      True if this currency type supports the exchange command set, which is used to exchange from items to/from virtual.

    • getHoldings

      default List<HoldingsEntry> getHoldings(Account account, String region, Currency currency, Identifier type)
      Used to get the holdings for a specific account from this currency type.
      Parameters:
      account - The uuid of the account.
      region - The name of the region involved. This is usually a world, but could be something else such as a world guard region name/identifier.
      currency - The instance of the currency to use.
      type - The Identifier of the holdings handler to use.
      Returns:
      The holdings for the specific account.

    • setHoldings

      default boolean setHoldings(Account account, String region, Currency currency, Identifier type, BigDecimal amount)
      Used to set the holdings for a specific account.
      Parameters:
      account - The uuid of the account.
      region - The name of the region involved. This is usually a world, but could be something else such as a world guard region name/identifier.
      currency - The instance of the currency to use.
      type - The Identifier of the holdings handler to use.
      amount - The amount to set the player's holdings to.
      Returns:
      True if the holdings have been set, otherwise false.

    • addDatabase

      default void addDatabase(Account account, String region, Currency currency, Identifier type, BigDecimal amount)
